intro: Calawaya exaltata, commonly known as the Hawaiian mountain ginger, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas of Hawaii. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture and a mild, spicy aroma. Calawaya exaltata plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various insect and bird species.
